comment._content: Hmm, looks familiar - I wonder where I saw this view before . . .

comment.author: 27331537@N06
comment._content: I believe this upload was a special request :)

comment.author: 32162360@N00
comment._content: [http://www.flickr.com/photos/state-records-nsw] Thanks State Records NSW (and pellethepoet). There are now so many pictures of Clyde Street I don't know where to begin. Maybe here - [http://www.flickr.com/photos/state-records-nsw/4255176740/] And here - www.hht.net.au/whats_on/exhibitions/exhibitions/painting_...

comment.author: 32162360@N00
comment._content: There is another picture in the Plague Albums (Vol. VI, No.18 - " 346. No. 2 Clyde Street [in volume labelled 348. Rear of Day-street] " ), which shows the distinctive 3-balconied corner house just to the left of this image, apparent in the Sydney Long artworks. It may also be in the State Records NSW Archive but under another name. Here is the image - acms.sl.nsw.gov.au/album/ItemViewer.aspx?itemid=823675&am... And the Album (State Library NSW) - acms.sl.nsw.gov.au/album/albumView.aspx?acmsID=413023&amp...

comment.author: 51979177@N02
comment._content: Here's a Julian Ashton rear view - www.artgallery.nsw.gov.au/work/5924/ Those circles on the footpath look like they're the work of kids...marble rings...or if the incline was too steep for marbles, maybe a hop-scotch course.

comment.author: 51979177@N02
comment._content: Another Julian Ashton...maybe looking back up this way from the bottom of the street - www.artgallery.nsw.gov.au/work/5857/
